nodes.text:
Easy there, {COMMANDER.FirstName}—you took a nasty crack on the head when you punched out.

Don't worry. You're safe now.

My name is Darius Oliveira, and I'm the XO of Markham's Marauders.

We're a mercenary outfit with ties to House Arano… we did some work for [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHighLordTamatiArano],High Lord Tamati]] way back when.

I'd introduce you to Commander Markham, but he was on a supply run in the Market District when the bombs fell. He, uh… well.

He didn't make it.

branches.responseText: If it wasn't for your company, I'd be dead, too.

nodes.text:
Seemed appropriate, given the circumstances. After seeing what happened to Markham, it didn't feel right leaving you in the hands of this new "Directorate."

When we picked up your broadcast on the emergency band, we knew what we had to do.

branches.responseText: What about Mastiff? Sir Raju Montgomery—did you find him?
Were you able to recover my Blackjack?

nodes.text:
We found his 'Mech. It was completely cored out. Nobody survives a hit like that.

For what it's worth, I'm sorry. We supported the Royal Guard on a handful of deployments, and Sir Raju earned my respect many times over. His death is a loss for us all.

Yeah, our MechTech hauled what's left of it into the Mech Bay. It isn't pretty, but if you give him enough time, Yang can fix just about anything.

Try not to take the loss too hard. Yang said that your 'Mech shows signs of deliberate sabotage… whoever you had working on it really did a number on the reactor. Punching out was the right move.

You should be pleased to hear that we also rescued Lady Arano after she was able to eject from that exploding DropShip and she's on the bridge with our pilot. 

But it appears that the coup has succeeded and [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHouseEspinosa],House Espinosa]]'s Directorate is the new de facto government of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAuriganReach],Aurigan Reach]]. So I guess it's exile for her and her supporters.

branches.responseText: I didn't think she'd made it.
At least Mastiff didn't die for nothing.
Damn it. It seems she has no where to go.

nodes.text:
Our sentiments exactly. We're getting the hell out of Aurigan territory—I've already booked transport on the first [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreJumpShip],JumpShip]] out.

We're heading to a nice, quiet stretch of independent space all the way across the Frontier, on the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHyadesRim],Hyades Rim]]. Not a cheap trip, but we'll worry about how we're gonna pay for it later.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_Kurita],Draconis Combine]]. If you want, I could try to book you transport on a freighter bound for Kurita space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Draconis Combine]</color> The Combine isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Free Worlds League]</color> The League isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Federated Suns]</color> The Federation isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Lyran Commonwealth]</color> The Commonwealth isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Capellan Confederation]</color> The Confederation isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Magistracy of Canopus]</color> The Magistracy isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Taurian Concordat]</color> The Concordat isn't my home. Never has been. My family moved to the Reach before I was born.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Background: Frontier Freelancer]</color> I know how to live on the Frontier. If that's where you're going, I guess I'm with you.
No way. I'll be damned if I'm gonna let the Directorate chase me away.
That's ancient history… and besides, I'm broke. What's Option B?

nodes.text:
In that case, you could stay with us for the long haul. When we get where we're going, we can drop you at the nearest planet… maybe you can make a place for yourself there.

Of course, I'll need you to pitch in for your share of the fuel—plus food, lodging, and repairs on your 'Mech. Fair's fair, after all.

…Alternatively, you could find a place for yourself in the Marauders if you wanted to. Wouldn't take you long to work off your debt, and you ran with Mastiff, so I know you've got chops. Think it over. Sleep on it. You've had a hell of a day, and we've got a long road ahead.

You're welcome to stay aboard for as long as you like. When we get near the Taurian border, we'll drop you off on the planet of your choosing.

Of course, we'll need you to pitch in for your share of the fuel—plus food, lodging, and repairs on your 'Mech. Fair's fair, after all.

Well, you could stay with us for the long haul. When we get where we're going, we can drop you at the nearest planet… maybe you can make a place for yourself there.

Of course, I'd need you to pitch in for your share of the fuel—plus food, lodging, and repairs on your 'Mech. That might be tough if you're strapped for cash.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_Marik],Free Worlds League]]. If you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter bound for Marik space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_Davion],Federated Suns]]. If you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter bound for Davion space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_Steiner],Lyran Commonwealth]]. If you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter bound for Steiner space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_Liao],Capellan Confederation]]. If you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter bound for Liao space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

As for you… well, you've got options.

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the Magistracy of Canopus. Like I said, we're heading that way… if you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter. Maybe we can get you the rest of the way home.

As for you… well, you've got options. 

According to your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family out in the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian Concordat]]. If you want, I could look into booking you transport on a freighter bound for Taurian space. I can't make any promises, but I'm willing to try.

Now. According to the info on your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], you've got family in the Deep Periphery. I'm afraid that's going to make getting you back there difficult… there aren't many freighter captains who're willing to travel that far from the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreInnerSphere],Inner Sphere]].

So the way I see it, you've got a couple of options.

You could stay with us for the long haul if you wanted… that's Option A. When we get where we're going, we can drop you at the nearest planet; maybe you can make a place for yourself there.

Of course, I'll need you to pitch in for your share of the fuel—plus food, lodging, and repairs on your 'Mech. Fair's fair, after all.

Now. According to the info on your [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBloodChit],blood chit]], your roots are right here, in the Rimward Periphery. That puts you and me in the same boat… our homes are too close to the Directorate for comfort.

So the way I see it, you've got a couple of options.

When we get where we're going, we can drop you at the nearest planet. Maybe you can make a place for yourself there.

Of course, I'll need you to pitch in for your share of the fuel—plus food, lodging, and repairs on your 'Mech. Fair's fair, after all.

He died doing his duty. From what I remember of the old man, that's exactly how he'd have wanted to go.

Speaking of going, we're getting the hell out of Aurigan territory. We're heading to a nice, quiet stretch of independent space called the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHyadesRim],Hyades Rim]], near [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian]] territory.

Yeah… I am, too. He was a good man.

A lot of good people died today.

We picked up your distress beacon on the emergency band as we were on our way off-planet. After seeing what'd happened to Markham, it didn't feel right leaving you in the hands of this new "Directorate."

We did a sweep of the combat site, grabbed your ejection pod, and ran.

That's probably true, but don't mention it. After seeing what happened to Markham, it didn't feel right leaving you in the hands of this new "Directorate."

When we picked up your broadcast on the emergency band, we knew what we had to do.
